Package org.aeonbits.owner.util.bytesize

Class ByteSize

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.aeonbits.owner.util.bytesize.ByteSize

  • public class ByteSize
extends Object
    A unit of byte size, such as "512 kilobytes". This class models a two part byte count size, one part being a value and the other part being a ByteSizeUnit. This class supports converting to another ByteSizeUnit.
    Author:
    Stefan Freyr Stefansson

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Creates a byte size value from a long value and a ByteSizeUnit.
      ByteSize​(String value, ByteSizeUnit unit)
      Creates a byte size value from a String value and a ByteSizeUnit.
      ByteSize​(BigDecimal value, ByteSizeUnit unit)
      Creates a byte size value from two parts, a value and a ByteSizeUnit.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ByteSize

        public ByteSize​(BigDecimal value,
                ByteSizeUnit unit)
        Creates a byte size value from two parts, a value and a ByteSizeUnit.
        Parameters:
        value - the value part of this byte size.
        unit - the unit part of this byte size.

      • ByteSize

        public ByteSize​(long bytes)
        Creates a byte size value from a long value representing the number of bytes. The unit part of this byte size will be ByteSizeUnit.BYTES.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the number of bytes this ByteSize instance should represent

      • ByteSize

        Parameters:

        unit - the unit part of this byte size

    • Method Detail

      • getBytes

        public BigInteger getBytes​()
        Returns the number of bytes that this byte size represents after multiplying the unit factor with the value. Since the value part can be a represented by a decimal, there is some possibility of a rounding error. Therefore, the result of multiplying the value and the unit factor are always rounded towards positive infinity to the nearest integer value (see RoundingMode.CEILING) to make sure that this method never gives values that are too small.
        Returns:
        number of bytes this byte size represents after factoring in the unit.

      • getBytesAsLong

        public long getBytesAsLong​()
        Returns the number of bytes that this byte size represents as a long after multiplying the unit factor with the value, throwing an exception if the result overflows a long.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes that this byte size represents after factoring in the unit.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - if the result overflows a long

      • getBytesAsInt

        public int getBytesAsInt​()
        Returns the number of bytes that this byte size represents as an int after multiplying the unit factor with the value, throwing an exception if the result overflows an int.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes that this byte size represents after factoring in the unit.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - if the result overflows an int

      • convertTo

        public ByteSize convertTo​(ByteSizeUnit unit)
        Creates a new ByteSize representing the same byte size but in a different unit. Scale of the value (number of decimal points) is handled automatically but if a non-terminating decimal expansion occurs, an ArithmeticException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        unit - the unit for the new ByteSize.
        Returns:
        a new ByteSize instance representing the same byte size as this but using the specified unit.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - if a non-terminating decimal expansion occurs during calculation.
